news_header: The Bank of Finland is initiating the application process for a new Chairman of the Board of Directors, whose term lasts seven years, starting from July 12, 2025.
news_text: The term of office for the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Bank of Finland is seven years, with the next position opening on July 12, 2025. The Banking Supervisory Board has decided to begin the application process for this role during its meeting on October 18. The current Chairman is Olli Rehn, who is also the Director-General. Candidates must have a master's degree and substantial experience in monetary or financial activities, along with proven leadership and management skills.
